page.title: 03032 037 A PROSPECT
page.content: Here rural chalk downland slopes north to the Icknield Way & includes part of 5 parishes. To the south the land rises to 500ft giving way to heavy clay.Here are some Therfield's houses, around the green,church,chapel,school, shop,hall & pub.More people lived here in 1851.We have no estate building/ commercialism.We remain quite remote.Therfield Heath is an SSI.Land is carefully farmed,but useage has changed.Chalklands no longer support only sheep.Various cereal crops are grown but now no milking cows.Few trees have ever stood here.Winters are often harsh.Our rural community is quite close_knit,sharing societies & clubs with Kelshall.Most residents commute to work.Some old houses have been well restored.Property expensive; new houses rarely built.It's a conservation area.
